p: The distribution of the spot maps on the principal component analysis (PCA) plot given in Figure 3a shows that the most important differences were found between the samples of S. commersonii and Désirée ( Figure 3a; the X axis differentiates the species), irrespective of the treatment. In order to better consider differences among different treatments, the spot maps from each species were processed separately. PCA analysis of the spot maps from S. commersonii resulted in the separation of three groups: Control, Cold and Sucrose plus Sorbitol ( Figure 3b). The spot maps corresponding to Désirée can be separated into two clear groups: control and the stress treatments ( Figure 3c).
